 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 99.1 </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">

 </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="top"></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:18pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International Reports Q3 2021 Results </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Third Quarter Highlights </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Net revenues increased +7.8% driven by Organic Net Revenue<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP>
growth of +5.5%, favorable currency and acquisitions </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Diluted EPS was $0.89, up 14.1%; Adjusted EPS<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> was $0.71, up
+9.4% on a constant-currency basis </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Year-to-date</FONT></FONT> cash provided by
operating activities was $2.7&nbsp;billion, an increase of +$0.4&nbsp;billion versus prior year; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-to-date</FONT></FONT> Free Cash
Flow<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> was $2.1&nbsp;billion, an increase of +$0.4&nbsp;billion </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Returned $3.2&nbsp;billion of capital to shareholders <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-to-date</FONT></FONT> </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Raising full-year 2021 Organic Net Revenue growth outlook to approximately 4.5%, reaffirming Adjusted EPS and
Free Cash Flow outlook </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">Announced target of net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">CHICAGO, Ill. &#150; November&nbsp;2, 2021 &#150; Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. (Nasdaq: MDLZ) today reported its third quarter 2021
results. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;We delivered strong revenue and earnings growth in the third quarter with broad strength across both developed and
emerging markets. Demand for our categories and brands remains vibrant and volume growth is solid as we implement pricing to reflect higher inflation,&#148; said Dirk Van de Put, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. &#147;We expect elevated
inflation and logistics volatility to persist, but remain confident in our plans to deliver on our financial algorithm, supported by compounding brand investments, pricing as necessary, distribution expansion and our robust ESG agenda, including our
recently announced target of net zero emissions by 2050.&#148; </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I><U>Third Quarter Commentary </U></I></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Net revenues</B> increased 7.8&nbsp;percent driven by Organic Net Revenue growth of 5.5&nbsp;percent,
favorable currency, and incremental sales from the company&#146;s acquisitions of Hu, Grenade and Gourmet Food. Pricing and volume drove Organic Net Revenue growth. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Gross profit </B>increased $32&nbsp;million, while gross profit margin decreased 260 basis points to
39.3&nbsp;percent driven by the decrease in Adjusted Gross Profit<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> margin, higher restructuring costs and lower
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> gains from derivatives. Adjusted Gross Profit increased $57&nbsp;million at constant currency, while Adjusted Gross Profit margin decreased 160 basis
points to 38.3&nbsp;percent due to higher raw material and transportation costs and unfavorable mix, partially offset by pricing and manufacturing productivity. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Operating income </B>increased $159&nbsp;million and operating income margin was 18.0&nbsp;percent, up 100
basis points primarily due to lapping intangible asset impairment charges and reductions to contingent consideration liabilities related to acquisitions, partially offset by lower
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> gains from derivatives and lower Adjusted Operating Income<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> margin. Adjusted Operating Income
increased $52&nbsp;million at constant currency, and Adjusted Operating Income margin decreased 30 basis points to 17.2&nbsp;percent due to higher raw material and transportation costs, unfavorable mix and higher advertising and consumer costs,
partially offset by pricing, manufacturing productivity, lower overheads and lower amortization of intangible assets. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Diluted EPS</B> was $0.89, up 14.1&nbsp;percent, primarily due to an increase in Adjusted EPS, lapping prior
year intangible asset impairment charges, reductions to contingent consideration liabilities related to acquisitions, lower equity method investee items and lapping prior-year initial impacts from enacted tax law changes, partially offset by lower
gains on equity method investment transactions. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Adjusted EPS</B> was $0.71, up 9.4&nbsp;percent on a constant-currency basis driven by operating gains, fewer
shares outstanding, and lower income taxes in the quarter. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Capital Return</B>: The company returned $767&nbsp;million to shareholders in cash dividends and share
repurchases in the quarter. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2021 Outlook </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mondel&#275;z International provides its outlook on a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> basis, as the company cannot predict
some elements that are included in reported GAAP results, including the impact of foreign exchange. Refer to the Outlook section in the discussion of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures below for more details. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="76%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Organic Net Revenue Growth</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">~+4.5%</TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">$3B+</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company estimates currency translation would increase 2021 net revenue growth by approximately 2 percent<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">3</SUP> with a positive $0.09 impact to Adjusted EPS<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">3</SUP>. Outlook is provided in the context of greater than usual volatility as a result of <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19.</FONT> The company strategy and long-term algorithm remain unchanged. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Conference Call </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mondel&#275;z International will host a conference call for investors with accompanying slides to review its results at 5 p.m. ET today. A
listen-only webcast will be provided at <U>www.mondelezinternational.com</U>. An archive of the webcast will be available on the company&#146;s web site. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>About Mondel&#275;z International </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. (Nasdaq: MDLZ) empowers people to snack right in over 150 countries around the world. With 2020 net revenues
of approximately $27&nbsp;billion, MDLZ is leading the future of snacking with iconic global and local brands such as <I>Oreo</I>, <I>belVita</I> and <I>LU</I> biscuits; <I>Cadbury Dairy Milk</I>, <I>Milka</I> and <I>Toblerone</I> chocolate; <I>Sour
Patch Kids</I> candy and <I>Trident</I> gum. Mondel&#275;z International is a proud member of the Standard and Poor&#146;s 500, Nasdaq 100 and Dow Jones Sustainability Index. Visit <U>www.mondelezinternational.com</U> or follow the company on
Twitter at <U>www.twitter.com/MDLZ</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>End Notes </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">1.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">Organic Net Revenue, Adjusted Gross Profit (and Adjusted Gross Profit margin), Adjusted Operating Income (and
Adjusted Operating Income margin), Adjusted EPS, Free Cash Flow and presentation of amounts in constant currency are <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures. Please see discussion of
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures at the end of this press release for more information. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Additional Definitions </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Emerging markets consist of the Latin America region in its entirety; the Asia, Middle East and Africa region excluding Australia, New Zealand
and Japan; and the following countries from the Europe region: Russia, Ukraine, Turkey, Kazakhstan, Georgia, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovak Republic, Hungary, Bulgaria, Romania, the Baltics and the East Adriatic countries. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Developed markets include the entire North America region, the Europe region excluding the countries included in the emerging markets
definition, and Australia, New Zealand and Japan from the Asia, Middle East and Africa region. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Forward-Looking Statements </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This press release contains a number of forward-looking statements. Words, and variations of words, such as &#147;will,&#148;
&#147;expect,&#148; &#147;may,&#148; &#147;would,&#148; &#147;could,&#148; &#147;estimate,&#148; &#147;target,&#148; &#147;outlook&#148; and similar expressions are intended to identify the company&#146;s forward-looking statements, including, but
not limited to, statements about: the impact of and volatility resulting from the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</FONT> pandemic; the company&#146;s future performance, including its future revenue growth, earnings per share and cash
flow; currency and the effect of currency translation on the company&#146;s results of operations; confidence in the company&#146;s plans to deliver on its financial algorithm; inflation and logistics volatility; the company&#146;s target of net
zero greenhouse gas emissions; strategic transactions, including the Chipita acquisition; and the company&#146;s outlook, including 2021 Organic Net Revenue growth, Adjusted EPS growth and Free Cash Flow. These forward-looking statements are subject
to a number of risks and uncertainties, many of which are beyond the company&#146;s control, and many of these risks and uncertainties are currently amplified by and may continue to be amplified by the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</FONT> pandemic, including the spread of new variants of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19.</FONT> Important factors that could cause the company&#146;s actual results to differ materially from those
indicated in the company&#146;s forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, uncertainty about the effectiveness of efforts by health officials and governments to control the spread of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</FONT>
and inoculate and treat populations impacted by <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19;</FONT> uncertainty about the reimposition or lessening of restrictions imposed by governments intended to mitigate the spread of <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</FONT> and the magnitude, duration, geographic reach and impact on the global economy of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19;</FONT> the ongoing, and uncertain future, impact of the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</FONT> pandemic on the company&#146;s business, growth, reputation, prospects, financial condition, operating results (including components of the company&#146;s financial results), cash flows and liquidity; risks
from operating globally including in emerging markets; changes in currency exchange rates, controls and restrictions; volatility of commodity and other input costs; weakness in economic conditions; weakness in consumer spending; pricing actions; tax
matters including changes in tax laws and rates, disagreements with taxing authorities and imposition of new taxes; use of information technology and third party service providers; unanticipated disruptions to the company&#146;s business, such as
the malware incident, cyberattacks or other security breaches; global or regional health pandemics or epidemics, including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19;</FONT> competition; protection of the company&#146;s reputation and brand image;
</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
changes in consumer preferences and demand and the company&#146;s ability to innovate and differentiate its products; the restructuring program and the company&#146;s other transformation
initiatives not yielding the anticipated benefits; changes in the assumptions on which the restructuring program is based; management of the company&#146;s workforce; consolidation of retail customers and competition with retailer and other economy
brands; changes in the company&#146;s relationships with customers, suppliers or distributors; legal, regulatory, tax or benefit law changes, claims or actions; the impact of climate change on the company&#146;s supply chain and operations;
strategic transactions; significant changes in valuation factors that may adversely affect the company&#146;s impairment testing of goodwill and intangible assets; perceived or actual product quality issues or product recalls; failure to maintain
effective internal control over financial reporting; volatility of and access to capital or other markets and the company&#146;s liquidity; pension costs; the expected discontinuance of London Interbank Offered Rates and transition to any other
interest rate benchmark; and the company&#146;s ability to protect its intellectual property and intangible assets. Please also see the company&#146;s risk factors, as they may be amended from time to time, set forth in its filings with the U.S.
Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;), including the company&#146;s most recently filed Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K.</FONT> Mondel&#275;z International disclaims and does not undertake any obligation to
update or revise any forward-looking statement in this press release, except as required by applicable law or regulation. In addition, historical, current and forward-looking sustainability-related statements may be based on standards for measuring
progress that are still developing, internal controls and processes that continue to evolve, and assumptions that are subject to change in the future. The information included in, and any issues identified as material for purposes of, this document
may not be considered material for SEC reporting purposes. In the context of this disclosure, the term &#147;material&#148; is distinct from, and should not be confused with, such term as defined for SEC reporting purposes. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Financial Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company reports its
financial results in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (&#147;GAAP&#148;). However, management believes that also presenting certain <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures
provides additional information to facilitate the comparison of the company&#146;s historical operating results and trends in its underlying operating results, and provides additional transparency on how the company evaluates its business.
Management uses these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures in making financial, operating and planning decisions and in evaluating the company&#146;s performance. The company also believes that presenting these
measures allows investors to view its performance using the same measures that the company uses in evaluating its financial and business performance and trends. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company considers quantitative and qualitative factors in assessing whether to adjust for the impact of items that may be significant or that could affect
an understanding of its ongoing financial and business performance and trends. The adjustments generally fall within the following categories: acquisition&nbsp;&amp; divestiture activities, gains and losses on intangible asset sales and <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairments, major program restructuring activities, constant currency and related adjustments, major program financing and hedging activities and other major items affecting comparability of operating
results. See below for a description of adjustments to the company&#146;s U.S. GAAP financial measures included herein. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> information should be considered as supplemental in nature and is not meant to be considered in isolation or
as a substitute for the related financial information prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP. In addition, the company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures may not be the same as or comparable to similar <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures presented by other companies. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>DEFINITIONS OF THE COMPANY&#146;S
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">NON-GAAP</FONT> FINANCIAL MEASURES </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial
measures and corresponding metrics reflect how the company evaluates its operating results currently and provide improved comparability of operating results. As new events or circumstances arise, these definitions could change. When these
definitions change, the company provides the updated definitions and presents the related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> historical results on a comparable basis. When items no longer impact the company&#146;s current or future
presentation of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> operating results, the company removes these items from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions. In the second quarter of 2021, the company added to the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions the exclusion of initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. In the third quarter of 2021, the company also added the exclusion of contingent consideration adjustments and the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from equity method investment derivative contracts. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Organic Net Revenue&#148;</B> is defined as net revenues excluding the impacts of acquisitions,
divestitures and currency rate fluctuations. The company also evaluates Organic Net Revenue growth from emerging markets and developed markets. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Adjusted Gross Profit&#148;</B> is defined as gross profit excluding the impacts of the Simplify to Grow
Program; acquisition integration costs; the operating results of divestitures; and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity, forecasted currency and equity method
investment transaction derivative contracts. The company also presents &#147;Adjusted Gross Profit margin,&#148; which is subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted Gross Profit. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted
Gross Profit on a constant currency basis. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Adjusted Operating Income&#148;</B> and <B>&#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income&#148;</B> are defined
as operating income (or segment operating income) excluding the impacts of the items listed in the Adjusted Gross Profit definition as well as gains or losses (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairment charges) on
goodwill and intangible assets; divestiture or acquisition gains or losses, divestiture-related costs, acquisition-related costs, and acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration adjustments; remeasurement of net monetary position;
impacts from resolution of tax matters; CEO transition remuneration; impact from pension participation changes; initial impacts from enacted tax law changes; and costs associated with the JDE Peet&#146;s transaction. The company also presents
&#147;Adjusted Operating Income margin&#148; and &#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin,&#148; which are subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income. The company also evaluates growth in
the company&#146;s Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income on a constant currency basis. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Adjusted EPS&#148;</B> is defined as diluted EPS attributable to Mondel&#275;z International from
continuing operations excluding the impacts of the items listed in the Adjusted Operating Income definition, as well as losses on debt extinguishment and related expenses; gains or losses on equity method investment transactions; net earnings from
divestitures; and gains or losses on interest rate swaps no longer designated as accounting cash flow hedges due to changed financing and hedging plans. Similarly, within Adjusted EPS, the company&#146;s equity method investment net earnings exclude
its proportionate share of its investees&#146; significant operating and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items. The tax impact of each of the items excluded from the company&#146;s GAAP results was computed based on the facts
and tax assumptions associated with each item, and such impacts have also been excluded from Adjusted EPS. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted EPS on a constant currency basis. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Free Cash Flow&#148;</B> is defined as net cash provided by operating activities less capital
expenditures. Free Cash Flow is the company&#146;s primary measure used to monitor its cash flow performance. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">See the attached
schedules for supplemental financial data and corresponding reconciliations of the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures referred to above to the most comparable GAAP financial measures for the three months and nine
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 and September&nbsp;30, 2020. See Items Impacting Comparability of Operating Results below for more information about the items referenced in these definitions that specifically impacted the company&#146;s
results. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SEGMENT OPERATING INCOME </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company uses
segment operating income to evaluate segment performance and allocate resources. The company believes it is appropriate to disclose this measure to help investors analyze segment performance and trends. Segment operating income excludes unrealized
gains and losses on hedging activities (which are a component of cost of sales), general corporate expenses (which are a component of selling, general and administrative expenses), amortization of intangibles, gains and losses on divestitures and
acquisition-related costs (which are a component of selling, general and administrative expenses) in all periods presented. The company excludes these items from segment operating income in order to provide better transparency of its segment
operating results. Furthermore, the company centrally manages benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income and interest and other expense, net. Accordingly, the company does not present these items by segment because they
are excluded from the segment profitability measure that management reviews. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>ITEMS IMPACTING COMPARABILITY OF OPERATING RESULTS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The following information is provided to give qualitative and quantitative information related to items impacting comparability of operating results. The
company identifies these based on how management views the company&#146;s business; makes financial, operating and planning decisions; and evaluates the company&#146;s ongoing performance. In addition, the company discloses the impact of changes in
currency exchange rates on the company&#146;s financial results in order to reflect results on a constant currency basis. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Divestitures,
Divestiture-related costs and Gains/(losses) on divestitures </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Divestitures include completed sales of businesses (including the partial or full
sale of an equity method investment&#151;discussed separately below under the gains and losses on equity method investment transactions section) and exits of major product lines upon completion of a sale or licensing agreement. As the company
records its share of KDP and JDE Peet&#146;s ongoing earnings on a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-quarter</FONT> lag basis, any KDP or JDE Peet&#146;s ownership reductions are reflected as divestitures within the company&#146;s <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results the following quarter. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">The company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results include the impacts from the 2020
partial sales of its equity method investments in KDP and JDE Peet&#146;s and the second quarter 2021 sale of KDP shares as if the sales occurred at the beginning of all periods presented. See the section on gains/losses on equity method
transactions below for more information. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Acquisitions, Acquisition-related costs and Acquisition integration costs </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the third quarter of 2021, the company began to exclude the impact of certain adjustments made to its acquisition contingent consideration liabilities
that were recorded at the date of acquisition. The company made this adjustment to better facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating performance across periods. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On May&nbsp;26, 2021, the company announced an agreement to acquire Chipita S.A., a leading croissants and baked snacks company in the Central and Eastern
European markets. The company expects the acquisition to close in the first half of 2022 after all regulatory and acquisition-related reviews are completed. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $6&nbsp;million in the nine months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company also incurred acquisition integration costs of $6&nbsp;million in the three and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021, as these expenses were incurred in preparation of the acquisition closing in the first
half of 2022. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;1, 2021, the company acquired Gourmet Food Holdings Pty Ltd, a leading Australian food company in the premium biscuit and
cracker category. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $32&nbsp;million in the three months and $59&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021, and operating income of $4&nbsp;million in the three months and
$7&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company also incurred acquisition-related costs of $7&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;25, 2021, the company acquired a majority interest in Lion/Gemstone Topco Ltd
(&#147;Grenade&#148;), a performance nutrition leader in the United Kingdom. The acquisition of Grenade expands the company&#146;s position into the premium nutrition market. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $22&nbsp;million in the
three months and $45&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021, and operating income of $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $4&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company also incurred
acquisition-related costs of $2&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On January&nbsp;4, 2021, the company acquired the
remaining 93% of equity of Hu Master Holdings, a category leader in premium chocolate in the United States, which provides a strategic complement to the company&#146;s snacking portfolio in North America through growth opportunities in chocolate and
other categories in the well-being segment. The initial cash consideration paid was $229&nbsp;million, net of cash received, and the company may be required to pay additional contingent consideration. The estimated fair value of the contingent
consideration obligation at the acquisition date was $132&nbsp;million and was determined using a Monte Carlo simulation based on forecasted future results. During the third quarter, based on latest estimates, the company recorded a $70&nbsp;million
reduction to the liability as recent economic and market conditions related to COVID and supply chain challenges in the U.S. have impacted the pace of growth. This reduction was recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses. As a result
of acquiring the remaining equity interest, the company consolidated the operation and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $9&nbsp;million ($7&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> related to
stepping up the company&#146;s previously-held $8&nbsp;million (7%) investment to fair value. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $11&nbsp;million in the three months and $27&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30,
2021, and operating income (inclusive of the adjustment to the contingent consideration liability) of $63&nbsp;million in the three months and $50&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company also incurred
acquisition-related costs of $9&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;1, 2020, the company acquired a majority
interest in Give&nbsp;&amp; Go, a North American leader in fully-finished sweet baked goods and owner of the famous <I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">two-bite</FONT></I><I><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP></I> brand of
brownies and the <I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Create-A-Treat</FONT></FONT></I><I><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP></I> brand, known for cookie and gingerbread house decorating kits.
The acquisition of Give&nbsp;&amp; Go provides access to the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">in-store</FONT> bakery channel and expands the company&#146;s position in broader snacking. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of
$106&nbsp;million and operating income of $6&nbsp;million in 2021. The company incurred acquisition-integrations costs of $3&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company also incurred acquisition-related costs of
$15&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Simplify to Grow Program </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The primary objective of the Simplify to Grow Program is to reduce the company&#146;s operating cost structure in both its supply chain and overhead costs. The
program covers severance as well as asset disposals and other manufacturing and procurement-related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Restructuring costs </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded restructuring
charges of $62&nbsp;million in the three months and $250&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 and $68&nbsp;million in the three months and $111&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020 within asset
impairment and exit costs and benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income. These charges were for severance and related costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> asset write-downs (including accelerated
depreciation and asset impairments) and other adjustments, including any gains on sale of restructuring program assets. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Implementation costs </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Implementation costs primarily relate to reorganizing the company&#146;s operations and facilities in connection with its supply chain reinvention program and
other identified productivity and cost saving initiatives. The costs include incremental expenses related to the closure of facilities, costs to terminate certain contracts and the simplification of the company&#146;s information systems. The
company recorded implementation costs of $65&nbsp;million in the three months and $132&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 and $46&nbsp;million in the three months and $141&nbsp;million in the nine months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2020. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Intangible asset impairment charges </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company evaluates its goodwill and intangible asset impairment risk quarterly using qualitative analysis. In light of the ongoing <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</FONT> global pandemic, the company performed further quantitative analysis over indefinite-life intangible assets and recorded approximately $32&nbsp;million of intangible asset charges in the second quarter of
2021 and $90&nbsp;million in the second quarter of 2020. The impairment charges were recorded within asset impairment and exit costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the
company&#146;s 2021 annual testing of indefinite-life intangible assets, there were no impairments noted. During the company&#146;s 2020 annual testing of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-amortizable</FONT> intangible assets, the company
recorded approximately $54&nbsp;million of impairment charges in the third quarter of 2020 related to three gum and chocolate brands. In 2020, the ongoing impact of the pandemic resulted in greater declines in the sales and earnings for certain
brands, particularly the company&#146;s gum brands. The impairment charges were recorded within asset impairment and exit costs. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts
from commodity and currency derivative contracts </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company excludes unrealized gains and losses <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts) from outstanding commodity, forecasted currency and equity method investment transaction derivative contracts from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings
measures. The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts of commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives are excluded until such time that the related exposures impact the
company&#146;s operating results. Since the company purchases commodity and forecasted currency transaction contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, the company makes this adjustment to remove
the volatility of these future inventory purchases on current operating results to facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating performance across periods. The company excludes equity method investment derivative contract settlements as they
represent protection of value for future divestitures. The company recorded net unrealized gains on commodity, forecasted currency and equity method transaction derivatives of $134&nbsp;million in the three months and $268&nbsp;million in the nine
months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021, and recorded net unrealized gains of $148&nbsp;million in the three months and net unrealized losses of $38&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Remeasurement of net monetary position </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the
second quarter of 2018, primarily based on published estimates which indicated that Argentina&#146;s three-year cumulative inflation rate exceeded 100%, the company concluded that Argentina became a highly inflationary economy for accounting
purposes. As of July&nbsp;1, 2018, the company began to apply highly inflationary accounting for its Argentinean subsidiaries and changed their functional currency from the Argentinean peso to the U.S. dollar. On July&nbsp;1, 2018, both monetary and
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-monetary</FONT> assets and liabilities denominated in Argentinian pesos were remeasured into U.S. dollars. As of each subsequent balance sheet date, Argentinean peso denominated monetary assets and liabilities
were remeasured into U.S. dollars using the exchange rate as of the balance sheet date, with remeasurement and other transaction gains and losses recorded in net earnings. Within selling, general and administrative expenses, the company recorded
remeasurement losses of $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $10&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021, and $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $7&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020 related
to the revaluation of the Argentinean peso denominated net monetary position over these periods. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Impact from pension participation changes
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The impact from pension participation changes represent the charges incurred when employee groups are withdrawn from multiemployer pension plans
and other changes in employee group pension plan participation. The company excludes these charges from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results because those amounts do not reflect the company&#146;s ongoing pension obligations.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the third quarter of 2021, the company terminated its Defined Benefit Pension Scheme in Nigeria. During the second quarter of 2021, the company
made a decision to freeze its Defined Benefit Pension Scheme in the United Kingdom. As a result of these actions, the company recognized a curtailment credit of $3&nbsp;million for the three months and $17&nbsp;million for the nine months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2021 recorded within benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income. In connection with the United Kingdom plan freeze, the company also incurred incentive payment charges and other expenses related to
this decision of $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $47&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 included in operating income. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;11, 2019, the company received an undiscounted withdrawal liability assessment related to the company&#146;s complete withdrawal from the Bakery
and Confectionery Union and Industry International Pension Fund totaling $526&nbsp;million and requiring <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pro-rata</FONT> monthly payments over 20 years. The company began making monthly payments during the third
quarter of 2019. The company recorded $2&nbsp;million of accreted interest in the three months and $8&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 and $3&nbsp;million in the three months and $9&nbsp;million in the nine months ended
September&nbsp;30, 2020 on the long-term liability within interest and other expense, net. As of September&nbsp;30, 2021, the remaining discounted withdrawal liability was $364&nbsp;million, with $14&nbsp;million recorded in other current
liabilities and $350&nbsp;million recorded in long-term other liabilities. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;31, 2021, the company completed an early redemption of euro (&#128;1,200 million) and U.S. dollar ($992 million) denominated notes. The company
recorded $137&nbsp;million of extinguishment loss and debt-related expenses within interest and other expense, net related to $110&nbsp;million paid in excess of carrying value of the debt and recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred financing
in earnings and $27&nbsp;million foreign currency derivative loss related to the redemption payment at the time of the debt extinguishment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss
related to interest rate swaps </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Within interest and other expense, net, the company recognized a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT>
loss related to forward-starting interest rate swaps of $103&nbsp;million ($79&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> in the first quarter of 2020 due to the changes in related forecasted debt. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Initial impacts from enacted tax law changes </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company excludes initial impacts from enacted tax law changes from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures as they do not
reflect its ongoing tax obligations under the enacted tax law changes. Initial impacts include items such as the remeasurement of deferred tax balances and the transition tax from the 2017 U.S. tax reform. Previously, the company only excluded the
initial impacts from more material tax reforms, specifically the impacts of the 2019 Swiss tax reform and 2017 U.S. tax reform. To facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating results, the company has recast all
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">historical&nbsp;non-GAAP&nbsp;earnings</FONT> measures to exclude the&nbsp;initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded a net tax benefit of $4&nbsp;million from a decrease of its deferred tax liabilities resulting from enacted tax legislation in the three
months and a net tax expense from the increase of its deferred tax liabilities resulting from enacted tax legislation (mainly in the United Kingdom) of $95&nbsp;million in the nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2021. The company recorded a net tax
expense from the increase of its deferred tax liabilities resulting from enacted tax legislation (mainly in the United Kingdom) of $30&nbsp;million in the three months and nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Gains and losses on equity method investment transactions </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Keurig Dr Pepper Transactions: </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;4, 2020, the
company participated in a secondary offering of KDP shares and sold approximately 6.8&nbsp;million shares, which reduced its ownership interest by 0.5% of total outstanding shares. The company received $185&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $71&nbsp;million (or $54&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2020. On August&nbsp;3, 2020, the company sold approximately
14.1&nbsp;million shares of KDP, which reduced its ownership interest by 1.0% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $414&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of
$181&nbsp;million (or $139&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the third quarter of 2020. On September&nbsp;9, 2020, the company sold approximately 12.5&nbsp;million shares of KDP, which reduced its ownership
interest by 0.9% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $363&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $154&nbsp;million (or $119&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the third quarter of 2020. On November&nbsp;17, 2020, the company participated in a secondary offering of KDP shares and sold approximately 40.0&nbsp;million shares, which reduced the
company&#146;s ownership interest by 2.8% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $1,132&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $459&nbsp;million (or $350&nbsp;million <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the fourth quarter of 2020. On June&nbsp;7, 2021, the company participated in a secondary offering of KDP shares and sold approximately 28&nbsp;million shares, which reduced its ownership interest
by 2% to 6.4% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $997&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $520&nbsp;million (or $392&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the second quarter of 2021. The company considers these ownership reductions partial divestitures of its equity method investment in KDP. Therefore, the company has removed the equity method
investment net earnings related to this divested portion from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial results for Adjusted EPS for all historical periods presented to facilitate comparison of results. The company&#146;s U.S.
GAAP results, which include its equity method investment net earnings from KDP, did not change from what was previously reported. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On August&nbsp;2, 2021,
the company participated in a secondary offering of KDP shares and sold approximately $14.7&nbsp;million shares of KDP, which reduced its ownership interest by 1% to 5.3% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $500&nbsp;million of
proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $248&nbsp;million (or $189&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the third quarter of 2021. As the company records its share of KDP
ongoing earnings on a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-quarter</FONT> lag basis, any KDP ownership reductions are reflected as divestitures within <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results the following quarter. As such, the
company will recast divestitures within its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results to reflect the third quarter 2021 sales of KDP shares in the fourth quarter of 2021. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>JDE Peet&#146;s Transaction: </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In May 2020, JDE
Peet&#146;s B.V. (renamed JDE Peet&#146;s N.V. immediately prior to Settlement (as defined below), &#147;JDE Peet&#146;s&#148;) consummated the offering, listing and trading of its ordinary shares on Euronext Amsterdam, a regulated market operated
by Euronext Amsterdam N.V. (the &#147;admission&#148;). In connection with this transaction, JDE Peet&#146;s and the selling shareholders, including the company, agreed to sell at a price of &#128;31.50 per ordinary share a total of approximately
82.1&nbsp;million ordinary shares, including ordinary shares subject to an over-allotment option. The ordinary shares were listed and first traded on May&nbsp;29, 2020, and payment for, and delivery of, the ordinary shares sold in the offering
(excluding ordinary shares subject to the over-allotment option) took place on June&nbsp;2, 2020 (&#147;Settlement&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Prior to Settlement, the
company exchanged its 26.4% ownership interest in JDE for a 26.5% equity interest in JDE Peet&#146;s. The company did not invest new capital in connection with the transaction and the exchange was accounted for as a change in interest transaction.
Upon Settlement, the company sold approximately 9.7&nbsp;million of its ordinary shares in JDE Peet&#146;s in the offering for gross proceeds of &#128;304&nbsp;million ($343 million). The company subsequently sold approximately 1.4&nbsp;million
additional shares and received gross proceeds of &#128;46&nbsp;million ($51 million) upon exercise of the over-allotment option. Following Settlement and the exercise of the over-allotment option, the company held a 22.9% equity interest in JDE
Peet&#146;s. During the second quarter of 2020, the company recorded a preliminary gain of $121&nbsp;million, net of $33&nbsp;million released from accumulated other comprehensive losses, and incurred $48&nbsp;million of transaction costs. The
company also incurred a $261 </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
million tax expense. During the third quarter of 2020, the company increased its preliminary gain by $10&nbsp;million to $131&nbsp;million. During the fourth quarter of 2020, the company recorded
a $7&nbsp;million loss related to a minor dilution of its ownership percentage and reduced its tax expense by $11&nbsp;million to $250&nbsp;million and the associated cash tax will be paid by the end of 2021. In addition, the company considers the
3.6% ownership reduction a partial divestiture of its equity method investment in JDE Peet&#146;s. Therefore, the company has removed the equity method investment net earnings related to this divested portion from its
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial results for Adjusted EPS for all historical periods presented to facilitate comparison of results. The company&#146;s U.S. GAAP results, which include its equity method investment net
earnings from JDE Peet&#146;s, did not change from what was previously reported. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Equity method investee items </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Within Adjusted EPS, the company&#146;s equity method investment net earnings exclude its proportionate share of its equity method investees&#146; significant
operating and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items, such as acquisition and divestiture-related costs and restructuring program costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Constant currency </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Management evaluates the
operating performance of the company and its international subsidiaries on a constant currency basis. The company determines its constant currency operating results by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current period local currency
operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the company&#146;s financial statements in the comparable prior-year period to determine what the current-period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency
exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>OUTLOOK </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s outlook for 2021 Organic Net Revenue growth, Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis and Free Cash Flow are <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures that exclude or otherwise adjust for items impacting comparability of financial results such as the impact of changes in currency exchange rates, restructuring activities, acquisitions
and divestitures. The company is not able to reconcile its projected Organic Net Revenue growth to its projected reported net revenue growth for the full-year 2021 because the company is unable to predict during this period the impact from potential
acquisitions or divestitures, as well as the impact of currency translation due to the unpredictability of future changes in currency exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the
U.S. The company is not able to reconcile its projected Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis to its projected reported diluted EPS growth for the full-year 2021 because the company is unable to predict during this period the timing of
its restructuring program costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts and impacts from potential acquisitions
or divestitures as well as the impact of currency translation due to the unpredictability of future changes in currency exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the U.S. The
company is not able to reconcile its projected Free Cash Flow to its projected net cash from operating activities for the full-year 2021 because the company is unable to predict during this period the timing and amount of capital expenditures
impacting cash flow. Therefore, because of the uncertainty and variability of the nature and amount of future adjustments, which could be significant, the company is unable to provide a reconciliation of these measures without unreasonable effort.
</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>

  xmlns:link="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/linkbase"

    <link:loc xlink:href="https://xbrl.sec.gov/dei/2020/dei-2020-01-31.xsd#dei_CoverAbstract" xlink:type="locator" xlink:label="dei_CoverAbstract" />

<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
</TEXT>
